00035 /*
00036 The Apache module provided can also interpret AAP settings to map attributes to HTTP request headers and to Require rules, permitting
00037 protection of both static and dynamic content. Any of the typical ways of protecting content may be used ( .htaccess , or httpd.conf blocks
00038 including <Directory> , <Location> , <Files> , etc.). They define what content is to be protected and access control rules to apply against
00039 it.
00040 
00041 There are two ways to require Shibboleth authentication, but both also require enabling the module to activate by specifying an AuthType of
00042 shibboleth and supplying at least one Require rule in httpd.conf or .htaccess files. This is an Apache requirement. Without AuthType and
00043 Require in effect for a request, the Shibboleth filter will not be invoked by Apache and the request just passes through.
00044 
00045 The Require rule can enforce a specific access control policy based on attributes, can specify valid-user to require any authenticated
00046 session, or you can use a placeholder rule name of Shibboleth . This can be used when the actual protection rules are placed in the
00047 RequestMap, or to support LazySessions. In such cases, the module is activated, but in a passive mode that does not automatically force
00048 a session, but will process and validate a session if one exists, leaving the authorization decision to the application. Using a static
00049 access control rule that will fail in the absence of a session is only sensible if one of the two approaches below that force a session
00050 are used.
00051 
00052 To require a session, either the Apache command, ShibRequireSession On , or the requireSession boolean XML attribute on the closest
00053 RequestMap, Host, or Path elements in Shibboleth Xml can be used. Both approaches are equivalent, and using either one to require a
00054 session will supersede a false or absent setting of the other type. If your requests are still passing through, you may have forgotten
00055 to apply the Apache settings above.
00056 
00057 As an example, the following commands will simply require Shibboleth authentication for a resource:
00058 
00059 AuthType shibboleth
00060    ShibRequireSession On
00061    Require valid-user
00062 
00063 When you want to defer all decisions to the RequestMap, you can apply the filter passively to all content like so:
00064 
00065 <Location />
00066    AuthType shibboleth
00067    Require shibboleth
00068 </Location>
00069 
00070 A complete list of Shibboleth Apache directives and their values is below:
00071 
00072 AuthType <string>          Use shibboleth for direct invocation, or Basic plus the ShibBasicHijack option described below.
00073 
00074 ShibBasicHijack <on/off>   Controls whether Shibboleth should or should not ignore requests with AuthType Basic . Defaults to off.
00075 
00076 AuthGroupFile <pathname>   Same as mod_auth ; collects values found in REMOTE_USER into a named group for access control. An attribute
00077                            must be mapped to REMOTE_USER for this to work (defaults to eduPersonPrincipalName). mod_auth will not support
00078                            group files when the Shibboleth module is loaded, since they share the same command.
00079 
00080 ShibRequireSession <on/off> Controls whether to require an authenticated session before passing control to the authorization phase
00081                             or the actual resource. Defaults to off .
00082 
00083 ShibRequireSessionWith <SessionInitiator_id> Initiate a session using a specific SessionInitiator if no session exists.
00084 
00085 ShibApplicationId <ApplicationId>   Set ApplicationId for this content.
00086 
00087 ShibRequireAll <on/off> Controls whether all Require rules specified must be satisfied before access to the resource is granted.
00088                         Defaults to off , which means any single rule can be satisfied, the usual Apache behavior.
00089 
00090 ShibDisable <on/off>    Disable all Shibboleth module activity here to save processing effort. Defaults to off. note: if a require
00091                         statement is set, there needs to be another AuthType defined to handle it.
00092 
00093 ShibRedirectToSSL <portnumber>   When this directive is set all non-ssl http GET or HEAD request are automatically redirected to https
00094                                  before processing by Shibboleth. Other methods (like POST) are presented an error page to block access.
00095                                  This is highly recommended in combination with setting your cookies to secure as it will prevent looping
00096                                  and enhance security. Of course you'll set it as ShibRedirectToSSL 443 most of the time.
00097                                  (available from v1.3d)
00098 
00099 ShibURLScheme <http/https>    Used in advanced virtual hosting environments which need to generate SSL redirects from virtual servers
00100                               that use only HTTP (eg when offloading SSL to another machine). With this directive you can force Shibboleth
00101                               to send out a redirect to the HANDLER (eg Shibboleth.sso) on https, even though it runs on http when looking
00102                               at the local machine. Supplements the Apache ServerName and Port commands with this missing option. Defaults
00103                               to a null value in which the scheme for redirects is based on the physical connection to the server. This is
00104                               a server-level command, while the rest of the commands listed are content commands that can appear anywhere.
00105 
00106 ShibExportAssertion <on/off>  Controls whether the SAML attribute assertion provided by the AA is exported in a base64-encoded HTTP
00107                               header, HTTP_SHIB_ATTRIBUTES . Defaults to off .
00108 
00109 There are many ways that authorization can be performed once Shibboleth has successfully transported attributes; any module that performs
00110 a standard call can be used. The below example uses the standard pre-installed mod_auth by placing a .htaccess file that references a
00111 group file stored at /pathname :
00112 
00113 AuthGroupFile /pathname
00114     require group workgroup
00115 
00116 An AuthGroupFile used by Shibboleth might resemble:
00117    workgroup: joe@example.edu, jane@demo.edu, jim@sample.edu
00118 
00119 Require <string>  Enforce authorization using one of the following methods:
00120 
00121   * valid-user : Any Shibboleth user from a trusted !IdP site is accepted, even if no actual attributes are received. This is a very
00122                  minimal kind of policy, but is useful for testing or for deferring real policy to an application.
00123   * user       : A space-delimited list of values compared against REMOTE_USER , which is populated by default from
00124                  urn:mace:dir:attribute-def:eduPersonPrincipalName . Any attribute can be mapped to REMOTE_USER as defined by AAP.xml .
00125   * group      : A space-delimited list of group names defined within AuthGroupFile files, again provided that a mapping to REMOTE_USER
00126                  exists.
00127   * alias      : An arbitrary rule name that matches an Alias defined in an AAP.xml . The rule value is a space-delimited list of attribute
00128                  values, whose format depends on the attribute in question (e.g. an affiliation rule might look like:
00129                  require affiliation staff@osu.edu faculty@mit.edu=
00130   * shibboleth : If a session cookie of the expected name exists, the corresponding session will be validated and any cached attributes
00131                  exported as otherwise specified. Authorization will be controlled by the resource, unless additional rules are specified.
00132                  If however a session does not already exist, or if the current session expires or times out, no session will be requested
00133                  and control will pass to the resource. This is known as "lazy session" (see below).
00134 
00135 For user and alias-based rules, if a tilde character (~) is placed immediately following user or alias , the expressions that follow are
00136 treated as regular expressions. The syntax supported is generally based on the one defined by XML Schema. This specification borders on
00137 unreadable, but the syntax is generally Perl-like. Expressions should generally be "anchored" with the ^ and $ symbols to ensure mid-string
00138 matches don't cause false positives.
00139 
00140 For example, the rule:
00141 
00142 require affiliation ~ ^member@.+\.edu$
00143 
00144 would evaluate to allowing anyone with an eduPersonAffiliation of member from a .edu domain.
00145 */
00146 
00147 // per-dir module configuration structure
00148 
00149 typedef struct shib_dir_config {
00150    //
00151    // RM Configuration
00152 
00153    char* szAuthGrpFile;    // Auth GroupFile name
00154    int bRequireAll;        // all require directives must match, otherwise OR logic
00155 
00156    // Content Configuration
00157 
00158    char* szApplicationId;  // Shib applicationId value
00159    char* szRequireWith;    // require a session using a specific initiator?
00160    char* szRedirectToSSL;  // redirect non-SSL requests to SSL port
00161    int bOff;               // flat-out disable all Shib processing
00162    int bBasicHijack;       // activate for AuthType Basic?
00163    int bRequireSession;    // require a session?
00164    int bExportAssertion;   // export SAML assertion to the environment?
00165 } shib_dir_config;

00167 #include <ulib/string.h>

00169 template <class T> class UVector;
00170 
00171 class UShibTarget : public ShibTarget {
00172 public:
00173    shib_dir_config* m_dc;
00174 
00175    static const char* protocol;
00176    static const char* hostname;
00177    static int         port;
00178    static const char* uri;
00179    static const char* content_type;
00180    static const char* remote_addr;
00181    static const char* method;
00182 
00183    static const char* cookies;
00184    static const char* location;
00185 
00186    static uint32_t    postdata_len;
00187    static const char* postdata_ptr;
00188 
00189    static int               codepage;
00190    static UVector<UString>* sendpage;
00191    static UVector<UString>* setcookie;
00192 
00193     UShibTarget();
00194    ~UShibTarget() {}
00195 
00196    // Send a message to the Webserver log
00197 
00198    virtual void log(ShibLogLevel level, const string &msg);
00199 
00200    // Get/Set a cookie for this request
00201 
00202    virtual string getCookies(void) const;
00203    virtual void   setCookie(const string& name, const string& value);
00204 
00205    // Get the request's GET arguments or POST data from the server
00206 
00207    virtual string getArgs(void);
00208    virtual string getPostData(void);
00209 
00210    // Clear a header, set a header
00211    // These APIs are used for exporting the Assertions into the
00212    // Headers.  It will clear some well-known headers first to make
00213    // sure none remain.  Then it will process the set of assertions
00214    // and export them via setHeader().
00215 
00216    virtual void   clearHeader(const string& name);
00217    virtual void   setHeader(const string& name, const string& value);
00218    virtual string getHeader(const string& name);
00219    virtual void   setRemoteUser(const string& user);
00220    virtual string getRemoteUser(void);
00221 
00222    // We're done.  Finish up. Send specific result content or a redirect.
00223    // If there are no headers supplied assume the content-type is text/html
00224 
00225    virtual void* sendPage(const std::string& msg,
00226                           int code = 200, const std::string& content_type = "text/html",
00227                           const saml::Iterator<header_t>& headers = EMPTY(header_t));
00228 
00229    virtual void* sendRedirect(const string& url);
00230 
00231    // These next two APIs are used to obtain the module-specific "OK"
00232    // and "Decline" results.  OK means "we believe that this request
00233    // should be accepted".  Declined means "we believe that this is
00234    // not a shibbolized request so we have no comment".
00235 
00236    virtual void* returnDecline(void);
00237    virtual void* returnOK(void);
00238 };

00240 #include <ulib/net/server/server_plugin.h>

00242 /*
00243 The plugin interface is an integral part of UServer which provides a flexible way to add specific functionality to UServer.
00244 Plugins allow you to enhance the functionality of UServer without changing the core of the server. They can be loaded at
00245 startup time and can change virtually some aspect of the behaviour of the server.
00246 
00247 UServer has 5 hooks which are used in different states of the execution of the request:
00248 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00249 * Server-wide hooks:
00250 ````````````````````
00251 1) handlerConfig: called when the server finished to process its configuration
00252 2) handlerInit:   called when the server finished its init, and before start to run
00253 
00254 * Connection-wide hooks:
00255 ````````````````````````
00256 3) handlerRead:
00257 4) handlerRequest:
00258 5) handlerReset:
00259   called in `UClientImage_Base::handlerRead()`
00260 --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00261 
00262 RETURNS:
00263   U_PLUGIN_HANDLER_GO_ON         if ok
00264   U_PLUGIN_HANDLER_FINISHED if the final output is prepared
00265   U_PLUGIN_HANDLER_AGAIN    if the request is empty (NONBLOCKING)
00266 
00267   U_PLUGIN_HANDLER_ERROR         on error
00268 */
00269 
00270 class UModProxyService;
00271 
00272 class U_EXPORT UShibPlugIn : public UServerPlugIn {
00273 public:
00274 
00275         // COSTRUTTORI
00276 
00277                                 UShibPlugIn();
00278         virtual ~UShibPlugIn();
00279 
00280         // define method VIRTUAL of class UServerPlugIn
00281 
00282         // Server-wide hooks
00283 
00284         virtual int handlerConfig(UFileConfig& cfg);
00285         virtual int handlerInit();
00286 
00287         // Connection-wide hooks
00288 
00289         virtual int handlerRequest();
00290         virtual int handlerReset();
00291 
00292         // DEBUG
00293 
00294 #ifdef DEBUG
00295         const char* dump(bool reset) const;
00296 #endif
00297 
00298 protected:
00299         UString cookies;
00300         ShibTargetConfig* conf;
00301         UVector<UModProxyService*> vservice;
00302 
00303 private:
00304         UShibPlugIn(const UShibPlugIn&) : UServerPlugIn() {}
00305         UShibPlugIn& operator=(const UShibPlugIn&)                { return *this; }
00306 };
